Others: The New Orleans Pelicans swept the season series with the Washington Wizards after a 110-98 victory on Sunday afternoon.
The Pelicans played the game without their leading scorer, Jordan Poole.

Two days after Pelicans guard CJ McCollum tied a career-high 50 points, New Orleans' offensive attack was much more balanced on Sundayâ€”all five starters scored in double-figures, led by McCollum's 25 points.
The Pelicans made 18 three-pointers in consecutive games for the first time all season.
The Pelicans return home for two games, starting on Tuesday when they host the Minnesota Timberwolves.
